metadata.title: Tuesday, 11th December, 2018
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE TWELFTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a) why some workers at Mochipapa Research Centre in Choma District had not been paid their August, 2018 salaries as at 18th September, 2018;
(b) what the total number of the unpaid workers was;
(c) whether there were other months in 2018 when the workers were not paid their salaries; and
(d) if so, what measures the Government is taking to pay the salary arrears.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to procure an X-ray machine for St Margaret Hospital in Kasaba Ward in Chifunabuli Parliamentary Constituency; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.

questions.minister: Minister of Housing and Infrastructure Development
parts: (a) when the construction of the Kato Health Post in Mpunda Ward in Kapiri Mposhi Parliamentary Constituency will be completed;
(b) who the contractor for the project is; and
(c) why the contractor has abandoned the project.

questions.minister: Minister of Housing and Infrastructure Development
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to construct houses for civil servants in Mufumbwe District;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) if there are no such plans, why.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to electrify the area between Mgubudu and Lumezi Trading Centre along Lundazi Road, in Lumezi Parliamentary Constituency;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented;
(c) when the following Chiefs’ Palaces, within the same area, will be electrified:
(i) Mwasemphangwe; (ii) Chikomeni; and (iii) Zumwanda;
(d) what the total cost of the project at (c) is; and
(e) what the time frames for the completion of the projects at (a) and (c) are.

questions.minister: Minister of Water Development, Sanitation and Environmental Protection
parts: (a) what the progress on the Kafue Bulk Water Project in Kafue District is;
(b) how many jobs have been created under the Project;
(c) whether the payment of salaries to the workers is up-to-date; and
(d) whether the people that were displaced as a result of implementation of the Project have been fully compensated.
(a) why the construction of the following health facilities in Kabompo Parliamentary Constituency have stalled:
(i) Ndungo Rural Health Post in Kamisombo Ward; and (ii) a maternity wing at Mumbeji Rural Health Centre;
(b) when the construction works will resume; and
(c) what the estimated time frame for the completion of the outstanding works on each project is.
(a) when the project of opening up the water channels under the World Bank Climate Change Project in Lunga District will commence; and
(b) what has caused the delay in commencing the project.
(a) what measures the Government is taking to enhance the teaching and learning of science subjects in Kalabo District; and
(b) when the construction of laboratories and the procurement of laboratory equipment will commence in most schools in the District.

questions.minister: Minister of Community Development and Social Welfare
parts: (a) whether there are any outstanding payments to beneficiaries of the Social Cash Transfer Scheme;
(b) if so, how many beneficiaries, countrywide, were affected as of September, 2018;
(c) what has caused the delay in paying the beneficiaries;
(d) how often the beneficiaries are paid; and
(e) how long the current beneficiaries will remain on the Scheme.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to procure motor vehicles for the District Education Board Secretaries and District Education Standards Officers, countrywide;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) how many vehicles will be procured for each district.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to upgrade St Kalembe Mission Health  Centre in Manyinga Parliamentary Constituency to a zonal health centre;
(b) if so, when the plans  will be implemented; and
(c) if there are no such plans, why.
(a) when the construction of Milenge Trades Institute will resume;
(b) what has caused the delay in resuming the works; and
(c) what the cost of completing the outstanding works is.
(a) why the tarring of township roads in Vubwi District has stalled;
(b) when the works will resume;
(c) what the time frame for the completion of the project is;
(d) what the total cost of the project is; and
(e) who the contractor for the project is.
(a) when the electrification of Sikongo District will be completed; and
(b) what has caused the delay in completing the project.
(a) what Zambia’s foreign exchange reserves were as of:
(i) January, 2016; and (ii) December, 2017; and
(b) by what percentage the reserves increased or decreased between January, 2016 and December, 2017.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to rehabilitate Nalufwe and Kaminembe Primary Schools in Chisamba Parliamentary Constituency;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) if there are no such plans, why.
(a) whether the Government is aware that the construction of 12 portal frame classroom blocks in Lubansenshi Parliamentary Constituency have not been completed since 2006;
(b) what has caused the delay in completing the project; and
(c) when the project will be completed.

questions.minister: Minister of Lands and Natural Resources
parts: (a) when the land dispute between the Zambia Forests and Forestry Industries Corporation (ZAFFICO) and Mukuba University in Kitwe District will be resolved;
(b) how long the dispute has remained unresolved; and
(c) what the size of the land in contention is.

questions.minister: Minister of Housing and Infrastructure Development
parts: (a) when the construction of the following infrastructure in Lunga District will be completed:
(i) a post office; (ii) council houses; (iii) a police station; and (iv) a civic centre administration block; and
(b) what has caused the delay in completing the projects.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to promote tourism development in the Liuwa National Park;
(b) if so, what the immediate, medium and long term plans are;
(c) when the plans will be implemented; and
(d) what benefits will accrue to residents of Liuwa from the above plans.
(a) what the total domestic debt to contractors for road projects, countrywide, was as of 30th September, 2018;
(b) whether the Government has any plans to vary road contracts and remove the Clauses requiring the Government to pay interest and stand alone time on unpaid invoices;
(c) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(d) if there are no such plans, why.
(a) when the Mulungushi Textiles in Kabwe District will become operational;
(b) what has caused the delay in operationalising the company;
(c) who the new owners of the company are;
(d) what the capital investment by the new owners is; and
(e) how many jobs will be created when the company is operationalised.
(a) when the tarring of township roads in Kapiri Mposhi District will commence;
(b) what has caused the delay in commencing the project;
(c) who the contractor for the project is; and
(d) what the total cost of the project is.
